alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Rockdale (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:04AM EST until January 10 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia affecting DeKalb and Rockdale Counties. For the Yellow River Basin...including Lithonia...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Pleasant Hill Road near Lithonia. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Significant flooding continues to expand into the woodlands and fields near the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Pleasant Hill Road. In Dekalb County... flooding of the backyards of homes becomes more widespread on Harmony Hills Drive and Court. Johnson Creek flowing under Union Grove Road into the river continues to back up and reach the bottom of the bridge. In Rockdale County...some flooding of yards begins in the Lake Capri subdivision. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:16 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 18.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.5 feet on 05/07/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
